navigation.title: Match Coloured Objects
navigation.outcome: Fun activity where the child will draw lines to connect matching similar pairs of objects
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Match Coloured Objects 2
navigation.outcome: Fun activity where the child will draw lines to connect matching similar pairs of objects
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Match Blue Shadows
navigation.outcome: Fun activity where the child will draw lines to connect matching similar pairs of objects
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Animals and Babies
navigation.outcome: Match the babies with the animals and the tails with their bodies.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Shapes and Objects
navigation.outcome: Children learn to identify real life objects with the geometric shape name. For example balloon = oval, wheel = circle, etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Count and Match
navigation.outcome: Children count and match objects, which enhances the subitizing skills in children.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Shapes
navigation.outcome: Children match shapes - triangle, square, pentagon and hexagon.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Match figures
navigation.outcome: Fun activity where the child will draw lines to connect matching similar pairs of objects
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Count and Pair
navigation.outcome: Matching the tally marks to objects and numbers. 1-5
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: How Many
navigation.outcome: Children gain skill of subitizing, an ability to instantly recognize the number of objects without actually counting them. Through practice they learn to calculate estimates without actually counting the objects.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Parts and whole
navigation.outcome: Children will match the fraction of an object with its whole. This requires high observation, strong deductive and reasoning skills from the child to identify the similarities between two objects.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Parts and whole 2
navigation.outcome: Children will match the fraction of an object with its whole. This requires high observation, strong deductive and reasoning skills from the child to identify the similarities between two objects.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Objects and shapes
navigation.outcome: Children learn to identify real life objects with the geometric shape name. For example Ball = sphere, Dice = cube, cylinder = can, etc.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: 3D shapes
navigation.outcome: 3D shapes are presented to children from different angles. By matching similar objects by identification of their common properties, a child develops skills which can be applied in future to identify congruent or similar triangles, working problems of sets and many more math problems.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Stringed objects
navigation.outcome: The lesson has increased difficulty for a child by reducing the discrimination factor between two objects to be matched.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Tiny shapes
navigation.outcome: The lesson has increased difficulty for a child by reducing the discrimination factor between two objects to be matched.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Shape Sequence
navigation.outcome: Children arranges the shapes in a sequence.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Shape Series
navigation.outcome: The lesson uses patterns to represent identified regularities and to form generalizations in patterns which allows the child to see relationships and develop predictive skills. It is the ability to recognize and create patterns which helps to make predictions based on observations which is an important skill in math. Understanding patterns help prepare children for learning complex number concepts and mathematical operations as they progress in their learning with higher studies.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Shape Pattern
navigation.outcome: The lesson uses patterns to represent identified regularities and to form generalizations in patterns which allows the child to see relationships and develop predictive skills. It is the ability to recognize and create patterns which helps to make predictions based on observations which is an important skill in math. Understanding patterns help prepare children for learning complex number concepts and mathematical operations as they progress in their learning with higher studies.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Shape Order
navigation.outcome: The lesson uses patterns to represent identified regularities and to form generalizations in patterns which allows the child to see relationships and develop predictive skills. It is the ability to recognize and create patterns which helps to make predictions based on observations which is an important skill in math. Understanding patterns help prepare children for learning complex number concepts and mathematical operations as they progress in their learning with higher studies.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Bird
navigation.outcome: This is a simple game which improves drag and drop skills in students. They have to drag the animal puzzle pieces to their respectives places in order to complete the puzzle. As the student arranges pictures in an order the student actively exercises on the observation and remembering skills.
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle

navigation.title: Beginner
navigation.outcome: Children will match beginner level cards in this lesson. It will enhance the ability of a child to recognize the differences and similarities between two objects and images based on shape and size besides imparting good eye movement, eye teaming, and eye focusing skills to the child
navigation.subject: /Subject/puzzle
